instructions: Factorise each expression completely. This worksheet includes multi-step factorisation, expressions with two variables, grouping with negative factors, and word problems requiring factorisation.

questions.question: Factorise: x² - 36y²
questions.explanation: This is a difference of squares: x² - 36y² = x² - (6y)² = (x + 6y)(x - 6y).

questions.question: Factorise: 4x² - 25y²
questions.explanation: This is a difference of squares: 4x² - 25y² = (2x)² - (5y)² = (2x + 5y)(2x - 5y).

questions.question: Factorise: 2x³ - 18x
questions.explanation: Extract common factor: 2x(x² - 9). Then difference of squares: 2x(x + 3)(x - 3).

questions.question: Factorise: 3x³ - 48x
questions.explanation: Extract common factor: 3x(x² - 16). Then difference of squares: 3x(x + 4)(x - 4).

questions.question: Factorise: x⁴ - 16
questions.explanation: First: x⁴ - 16 = (x²)² - 4² = (x² + 4)(x² - 4). Then factorise (x² - 4): (x² + 4)(x + 2)(x - 2).

questions.question: Factorise by grouping: xy + 3x - 2y - 6
questions.explanation: Group: x(y + 3) - 2(y + 3) = (y + 3)(x - 2). Factor out -2 to match (y + 3).

questions.question: Factorise by grouping: 2xy + 6x - 5y - 15
questions.explanation: Group: 2x(y + 3) - 5(y + 3) = (y + 3)(2x - 5). Factor out -5 to match (y + 3).

questions.question: Factorise by grouping: 3xy + 12x - 4y - 16
questions.explanation: Group: 3x(y + 4) - 4(y + 4) = (y + 4)(3x - 4). Factor out -4 to match (y + 4).

questions.question: Factorise by grouping: ax + bx - 3a - 3b
questions.explanation: Group: x(a + b) - 3(a + b) = (a + b)(x - 3). Factor out -3 to match (a + b).

questions.question: Factorise by grouping: px + qx - 2p - 2q
questions.explanation: Group: x(p + q) - 2(p + q) = (p + q)(x - 2). Factor out -2 to match (p + q).

questions.question: The area of a rectangle is (x² + 7x + 12) cm². If the width is (x + 3) cm, what is the length?
questions.explanation: Area = length × width. Factorise: x² + 7x + 12 = (x + 3)(x + 4). So length = (x + 4) cm.

questions.question: The area of a square is (x² - 10x + 25) cm². What is the side length?
questions.explanation: x² - 10x + 25 = (x - 5)². Since area = side², the side length = (x - 5) cm.

questions.question: Factorise: x² + 2xy + y² - 4
questions.explanation: First: x² + 2xy + y² = (x + y)². Then: (x + y)² - 4 = (x + y + 2)(x + y - 2).

questions.question: Factorise: x² - 2xy + y² - 9
questions.explanation: First: x² - 2xy + y² = (x - y)². Then: (x - y)² - 9 = (x - y + 3)(x - y - 3).

questions.question: A picture frame has outer dimensions (x + 6) by (x + 6) and inner dimensions (x + 2) by (x + 2). Express the area of the frame in fully factorised form.
The difference between the areas of two squares is (x² - 16) cm². If the larger square has side x cm, what is the side of the smaller square?
questions.explanation: Larger area - Smaller area = x² - s² = x² - 16. So s² = 16, meaning s = 4 cm.

questions.question: Factorise completely: 3x³ + 9x² - 12x
questions.explanation: Extract common factor: 3x(x² + 3x - 4). Then factorise: 3x(x + 4)(x - 1).

questions.question: Factorise completely: 2x³ - 8x² - 10x
questions.explanation: Extract common factor: 2x(x² - 4x - 5). Then factorise: 2x(x - 5)(x + 1).
